91 BGPDUMP *bgpdump_open_dump(const char *filename) {
92 
93  CFRFILE *f = cfr_open(filename);
94  if(! f) {
95  fprintf(stderr, "Cannot open dumpfile %s: ", filename);
96  perror("");
97  return NULL;
98  }
99 
100  BGPDUMP *this_dump = malloc(sizeof(BGPDUMP));
101  strcpy(this_dump->filename, "[STDIN]");
102  if(filename && strcmp(filename, "-")) {
103  strcpy(this_dump->filename, filename);
104  }
105 
106  this_dump->f = f;
107  this_dump->eof=0;
108  this_dump->parsed = 0;
109  this_dump->parsed_ok = 0;
110  this_dump->corrupted_read = false;
111 
112  // peer index table shared among entries
113  this_dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table = NULL;
114 
115  return this_dump;
116 }
117 
118 
119 void bgpdump_close_dump(BGPDUMP *dump) {
120 
121  if(dump == NULL) {
122  return;
123  }
124 
125  // destroy current index table, if any
126  if(dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table){
127  if(dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table->entries) {
128  free(dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table->entries);
129  dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table->entries = NULL;
130  }
131  free(dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table);
132  dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table = NULL;
133  }
134  cfr_close(dump->f);
135  free(dump);
136 }
137 
138 
139 BGPDUMP_ENTRY* bgpdump_entry_create(BGPDUMP *dump){
140  BGPDUMP_ENTRY *this_entry = malloc(sizeof(BGPDUMP_ENTRY));
141  memset(this_entry, 0, sizeof(BGPDUMP_ENTRY));
142  this_entry->dump = dump;
143  return this_entry;
144 }
145 
146 
147 BGPDUMP_ENTRY* bgpdump_read_next(BGPDUMP *dump) {
148 
149  assert(dump);
150 
151  struct mstream s;
152  u_char *buffer;
153  int ok=0;
154  u_int32_t bytes_read;
155 
156  BGPDUMP_ENTRY *this_entry = bgpdump_entry_create(dump);
157 
158  // initialize corrupted_read
159  dump->corrupted_read = false;
160 
161  assert(this_entry);
162 
163  bytes_read = cfr_read_n(dump->f, &(this_entry->time), 4);
164  bytes_read += cfr_read_n(dump->f, &(this_entry->type), 2);
165  bytes_read += cfr_read_n(dump->f, &(this_entry->subtype), 2);
166  bytes_read += cfr_read_n(dump->f, &(this_entry->length), 4);
167  if(bytes_read != 12) {
168  if(bytes_read > 0) {
169  /* Malformed record */
170  dump->parsed++;
171  bgpdump_err("bgpdump_read_next: incomplete MRT header (%d bytes read, expecting 12)",
172  bytes_read);
173  dump->corrupted_read = true;
174  }
175  /* Nothing more to read, quit */
176  bgpdump_free_mem(this_entry);
177  this_entry = NULL;
178  dump->eof=1;
179  //printf("case 1\n");
180  return(NULL);
181  }
182 
183  dump->parsed++;
184 
185  /* Intel byte ordering stuff ... */
186  this_entry->type=ntohs(this_entry->type);
187  this_entry->subtype=ntohs(this_entry->subtype);
188  this_entry->time=ntohl(this_entry->time);
189  this_entry->length=ntohl(this_entry->length);
190  this_entry->attr=NULL;
191  buffer = malloc(this_entry->length);
192  bytes_read = cfr_read_n(dump->f, buffer, this_entry->length);
193  if(bytes_read != this_entry->length) {
194  bgpdump_err("bgpdump_read_next: incomplete dump record (%d bytes read, expecting %d)",
195  bytes_read, this_entry->length);
196  dump->corrupted_read = true;
197  //printf("case 2\n");
198  bgpdump_free_mem(this_entry);
199  this_entry = NULL;
200  free(buffer);
201  dump->eof=1;
202  return(NULL);
203  }
204 
205  ok=0;
206  mstream_init(&s,buffer,this_entry->length);
207 
208  switch(this_entry->type) {
209  case BGPDUMP_TYPE_MRTD_BGP:
210  break;
211  case BGPDUMP_TYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP:
212  ok = process_mrtd_table_dump(&s,this_entry);
213  break;
214  case BGPDUMP_TYPE_ZEBRA_BGP:
215  ok = process_zebra_bgp(&s,this_entry);
216  break;
217  case BGPDUMP_TYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2:
218  ok = process_mrtd_table_dump_v2(&s,this_entry);
219  break;
220  }
221 
222  free(buffer);
223  if(ok) {
224  dump->parsed_ok++;
225  } else {
226  //printf("case 3 - not corrupted, just empty beginning\n");
227  bgpdump_free_mem(this_entry);
228  this_entry = NULL;
229  return NULL;
230  }
231  return this_entry;
232 }
233 
234 
235 static void bgpdump_free_mp_info(struct mp_info *info) {
236  u_int16_t afi;
237  u_int8_t safi;
238 
239  for(afi = 1; afi <= BGPDUMP_MAX_AFI; afi++) {
240  for(safi = 1; safi < BGPDUMP_MAX_SAFI; safi++) {
241  if(info->announce[afi][safi])
242  free(info->announce[afi][safi]);
243  info->announce[afi][safi] = NULL;
244  if(info->withdraw[afi][safi]) {
245  free(info->withdraw[afi][safi]);
246  info->withdraw[afi][safi] = NULL;
247  }
248  }
249  }
250 
251  free(info);
252 }
253 
254 
255 void bgpdump_free_mem(BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry) {
256 
257  if(entry!=NULL) {
258  bgpdump_free_attr(entry->attr);
259  entry->attr = NULL;
260  switch(entry->type) {
261  case BGPDUMP_TYPE_ZEBRA_BGP:
262  switch(entry->subtype) {
263  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_ZEBRA_BGP_MESSAGE:
264  switch(entry->body.zebra_message.type) {
265  case BGP_MSG_NOTIFY:
266  if(entry->body.zebra_message.notify_data)
267  free(entry->body.zebra_message.notify_data);
268  break;
269  case BGP_MSG_OPEN:
270  if(entry->body.zebra_message.opt_data)
271  free(entry->body.zebra_message.opt_data);
272  break;
273  }
274  break;
275  }
276  break;
277  case BGPDUMP_TYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2:
278  if(entry->subtype == BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_RIB_IPV4_UNICAST ||
279  entry->subtype == BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_RIB_IPV6_UNICAST ){
280 
281  BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_PREFIX *e;
282  e = &entry->body.mrtd_table_dump_v2_prefix;
283  int i;
284 
285  for(i = 0; i < e->entry_count; i++){
286  bgpdump_free_attr(e->entries[i].attr);
287  e->entries[i].attr = NULL;
288  }
289  free(e->entries);
290  }
291  break;
292  }
293 
294  entry->dump = NULL;
295  free(entry);
296  }
297 }
298 
299 
300 void bgpdump_free_attr(attributes_t *attr){
301  if(attr != NULL) {
302  u_int16_t i;
303  struct aspath *path, *pathstofree[3] = { attr->aspath, attr->old_aspath, attr->new_aspath };
304  for(i = 0; i < (sizeof(pathstofree) / sizeof(pathstofree[0])); i++) {
305  path = pathstofree[i];
306  if(path) {
307  if(path->data)
308  free(path->data);
309  if(path->str) {
310  free(path->str);
311  }
312  free(path);
313  }
314  }
315 
316  if(attr->community != NULL) {
317  if(attr->community->val != NULL)
318  {
319  free(attr->community->val);
320  attr->community->val = NULL;
321  }
322 
323  if(attr->community->str != NULL)
324  {
325  free(attr->community->str);
326  attr->community->str = NULL;
327  }
328 
329  free(attr->community);
330  attr->community = NULL;
331  }
332 
333  if(attr->data != NULL)
334  free(attr->data);
335 
336  if(attr->mp_info != NULL)
337  bgpdump_free_mp_info(attr->mp_info);
338 
339  if(attr->cluster != NULL) {
340  free(attr->cluster->list);
341  free(attr->cluster);
342  }
343 
344  if (attr->unknown_num) {
345  for (i = 0; i < attr->unknown_num; i++)
346  free(attr->unknown[i].raw);
347  free(attr->unknown);
348  }
349 
350  free(attr);
351  }
352 }
353 
354 int process_mrtd_table_dump(struct mstream *s,BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry) {
355  int afi = entry->subtype;
356  u_int8_t asn_len;
357  u_int32_t temp_time = 0;
358  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.mrtd_table_dump.view);
359  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.mrtd_table_dump.sequence);
360  switch(afi) {
361  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP:
362  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP_32BIT_AS:
363  entry->body.mrtd_table_dump.prefix.v4_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
364  break;
365  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP6:
366  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP6_32BIT_AS:
367  mstream_get(s, &entry->body.mrtd_table_dump.prefix.v6_addr.s6_addr, 16);
368  break;
369  default:
370  bgpdump_warn("process_mrtd_table_dump: unknown AFI %d", afi);
371  mstream_get(s, NULL, mstream_can_read(s));
372  return 0;
373  }
374  mstream_getc(s,&entry->body.mrtd_table_dump.mask);
375  mstream_getc(s,&entry->body.mrtd_table_dump.status);
376  mstream_getl(s,&temp_time);
377  (entry->body).mrtd_table_dump.uptime = temp_time;
378 
379  switch(afi) {
380  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP:
381  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP_32BIT_AS:
382  entry->body.mrtd_table_dump.peer_ip.v4_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
383  break;
384  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP6:
385  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP6_32BIT_AS:
386  mstream_get(s, &entry->body.mrtd_table_dump.peer_ip.v6_addr.s6_addr, 16);
387  break;
388  }
389 
390  switch(afi) {
391  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP:
392  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP6:
393  asn_len = ASN16_LEN;
394  break;
395  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP_32BIT_AS:
396  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_MRTD_TABLE_DUMP_AFI_IP6_32BIT_AS:
397  asn_len = ASN32_LEN;
398  break;
399  default:
400  assert(0); // unreachable
401  return 0;
402  }
403 
404  read_asn(s,&entry->body.mrtd_table_dump.peer_as, asn_len);
405 
406  entry->attr = process_attributes(s, asn_len, NULL);
407 
408  return 1;
409 }
410 
411 
412 int process_mrtd_table_dump_v2(struct mstream *s,BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry) {
413 
414  switch(entry->subtype){
415  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_PEER_INDEX_TABLE:
416  return process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_peer_index_table(s, entry);
417  break;
418  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_RIB_IPV4_UNICAST:
419  return process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_ipv4_unicast(s, entry);
420  break;
421  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_RIB_IPV6_UNICAST:
422  return process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_ipv6_unicast(s, entry);
423  break;
424  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_RIB_GENERIC:
425  //return process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_generic(s, entry);
426  break;
427  }
428 
429  return 0;
430 }
431 
432 int process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_peer_index_table(struct mstream *s,BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry) {
433 
434  assert(entry->dump);
435 
436  BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_PEER_INDEX_TABLE *t;
437  uint16_t i;
438  uint8_t peertype;
439  uint16_t view_name_len;
440 
441  if(entry->dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table){
442  if(entry->dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table->entries)
443  free(entry->dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table->entries);
444  free(entry->dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table);
445  }
446 
447  entry->dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table = malloc(sizeof(BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_PEER_INDEX_TABLE));
448  t = entry->dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table;
449  t->entries = NULL;
450 
451  t->local_bgp_id = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
452 
453  mstream_getw(s,&view_name_len);
454  strcpy(t->view_name, "");
455 
456  // view_name_len is without trailing \0
457  if(view_name_len+1 > BGPDUMP_TYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_MAX_VIEWNAME_LEN) {
458  bgpdump_warn("process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_peer_index_table: view name length more than maximum length (%d), ignoring view name", BGPDUMP_TYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_MAX_VIEWNAME_LEN);
459  } else {
460  mstream_get(s, t->view_name, view_name_len);
461  t->view_name[view_name_len] = 0;
462  }
463 
464  mstream_getw(s,&t->peer_count);
465 
466  t->entries = malloc(sizeof(BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_PEER_INDEX_TABLE_ENTRY) * t->peer_count);
467  if(t->entries == NULL){
468  bgpdump_err("process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_peer_index_table: failed to allocate memory for index table");
469  return 0;
470  }
471 
472  for(i=0; i < t->peer_count; i++) {
473  mstream_getc(s,&peertype);
474  t->entries[i].afi = AFI_IP;
475  if(peertype & BGPDUMP_PEERTYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_AFI_IP6)
476  t->entries[i].afi = AFI_IP6;
477 
478  t->entries[i].peer_bgp_id = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
479 
480  if(t->entries[i].afi == AFI_IP)
481  t->entries[i].peer_ip.v4_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
482  else
483  mstream_get(s, &t->entries[i].peer_ip.v6_addr.s6_addr, 16);
484 
485 
486  if(peertype & BGPDUMP_PEERTYPE_TABLE_DUMP_V2_AS4)
487  read_asn(s, &t->entries[i].peer_as, 4);
488  else
489  read_asn(s, &t->entries[i].peer_as, 2);
490 
491  }
492  return 0;
493 }
494 
495 
496 int process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_ipv4_unicast(struct mstream *s, BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry){
497  BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_PREFIX *prefixdata;
498  prefixdata = &entry->body.mrtd_table_dump_v2_prefix;
499  uint16_t i;
500 
501  prefixdata->afi = AFI_IP;
502  prefixdata->safi = SAFI_UNICAST;
503 
504  mstream_getl(s, &prefixdata->seq);
505  mstream_getc(s, &prefixdata->prefix_length);
506  bzero(&prefixdata->prefix.v4_addr.s_addr, 4);
507  mstream_get(s, &prefixdata->prefix.v4_addr.s_addr, (prefixdata->prefix_length+7)/8);
508  mstream_getw(s, &prefixdata->entry_count);
509 
510  prefixdata->entries = malloc(sizeof(BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_ROUTE_ENTRY) * prefixdata->entry_count);
511  if(prefixdata->entries == NULL){
512  bgpdump_err("process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_ipv4_unicast: failed to allocate memory for entry table");
513  return 0;
514  }
515 
516  for(i=0; i < prefixdata->entry_count; i++){
517  BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_ROUTE_ENTRY *e;
518  e = &prefixdata->entries[i];
519 
520  mstream_getw(s, &e->peer_index);
521  e->peer = entry->dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table->entries[e->peer_index];
522  mstream_getl(s, &e->originated_time);
523 
524  e->attr = process_attributes(s, 4, NULL);
525  }
526 
527  return 1;
528 }
529 
530 
531 int process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_ipv6_unicast(struct mstream *s, BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry){
532  BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_PREFIX *prefixdata;
533  prefixdata = &entry->body.mrtd_table_dump_v2_prefix;
534  uint16_t i;
535 
536  prefixdata->afi = AFI_IP6;
537  prefixdata->safi = SAFI_UNICAST;
538 
539  mstream_getl(s, &prefixdata->seq);
540 
541  mstream_getc(s, &prefixdata->prefix_length);
542  bzero(&prefixdata->prefix.v6_addr.s6_addr, 16);
543  mstream_get(s, &prefixdata->prefix.v6_addr.s6_addr, (prefixdata->prefix_length+7)/8);
544 
545  mstream_getw(s, &prefixdata->entry_count);
546 
547  prefixdata->entries = malloc(sizeof(BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_ROUTE_ENTRY) * prefixdata->entry_count);
548  if(prefixdata->entries == NULL){
549  bgpdump_err("process_mrtd_table_dump_v2_ipv6_unicast: failed to allocate memory for entry table");
550  return 0;
551  }
552 
553  for(i=0; i < prefixdata->entry_count; i++){
554  BGPDUMP_TABLE_DUMP_V2_ROUTE_ENTRY *e;
555  e = &prefixdata->entries[i];
556 
557  mstream_getw(s, &e->peer_index);
558  e->peer = entry->dump->table_dump_v2_peer_index_table->entries[e->peer_index];
559  mstream_getl(s, &e->originated_time);
560 
561  e->attr = process_attributes(s, 4, NULL);
562  }
563 
564  return 1;
565 }
566 
567 int process_zebra_bgp(struct mstream *s,BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry) {
568  switch(entry->subtype) {
569  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_ZEBRA_BGP_STATE_CHANGE:
570  return process_zebra_bgp_state_change(s, entry, ASN16_LEN);
571  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_ZEBRA_BGP_STATE_CHANGE_AS4:
572  return process_zebra_bgp_state_change(s, entry, ASN32_LEN);
573  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_ZEBRA_BGP_MESSAGE:
574  return process_zebra_bgp_message(s, entry, ASN16_LEN);
575  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_ZEBRA_BGP_MESSAGE_AS4:
576  return process_zebra_bgp_message(s, entry, ASN32_LEN);
577  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_ZEBRA_BGP_ENTRY:
578  return process_zebra_bgp_entry(s,entry);
579  case BGPDUMP_SUBTYPE_ZEBRA_BGP_SNAPSHOT:
580  return process_zebra_bgp_snapshot(s, entry);
581  default:
582  bgpdump_warn("process_zebra_bgp: unknown subtype %d", entry->subtype);
583  return 0;
584  }
585 }
586 
587 int process_zebra_bgp_state_change(struct mstream *s,BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry, u_int8_t asn_len) {
588  read_asn(s, &entry->body.zebra_state_change.source_as, asn_len);
589  read_asn(s, &entry->body.zebra_state_change.destination_as, asn_len);
590 
591  /* Work around Zebra dump corruption.
592  * N.B. I don't see this in quagga 0.96.4 any more. Is it fixed? */
593  if (entry->length == 8) {
594  bgpdump_warn("process_zebra_bgp_state_change: 8-byte state change (zebra bug?)");
595 
596  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.zebra_state_change.old_state);
597  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.zebra_state_change.new_state);
598 
599  /* Fill in with dummy values */
600  entry->body.zebra_state_change.interface_index = 0;
601  entry->body.zebra_state_change.address_family = AFI_IP;
602  entry->body.zebra_state_change.source_ip.v4_addr.s_addr = 0;
603  entry->body.zebra_state_change.destination_ip.v4_addr.s_addr = 0;
604 
605  return 1;
606  }
607 
608  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.zebra_state_change.interface_index);
609  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.zebra_state_change.address_family);
610 
611  switch(entry->body.zebra_state_change.address_family) {
612  case AFI_IP:
613  // length could be 20 or 24 (asn16 vs asn32)
614  if(entry->length != 20 && entry->length != 24) {
615  bgpdump_warn("process_zebra_bgp_state_change: bad length %d",
616  entry->length);
617  return 0;
618  }
619 
620  entry->body.zebra_state_change.source_ip.v4_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
621  entry->body.zebra_state_change.destination_ip.v4_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
622  break;
623  case AFI_IP6:
624  // length could be 44 or 48 (asn16 vs asn32)
625  if(entry->length != 44 && entry->length != 48) {
626  bgpdump_warn("process_zebra_bgp_state_change: bad length %d",
627  entry->length);
628  return 0;
629  }
630 
631  mstream_get(s, &entry->body.zebra_state_change.source_ip.v6_addr.s6_addr, 16);
632  mstream_get(s, &entry->body.zebra_state_change.destination_ip.v6_addr.s6_addr, 16);
633  break;
634  default:
635  bgpdump_warn("process_zebra_bgp_state_change: unknown AFI %d",
636  entry->body.zebra_state_change.address_family);
637  return 0;
638  }
639  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.zebra_state_change.old_state);
640  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.zebra_state_change.new_state);
641 
642  return 1;
643 }
644 
645 int process_zebra_bgp_message(struct mstream *s,BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry, u_int8_t asn_len) {
646  u_char marker[16]; /* BGP marker */
647 
648  read_asn(s, &entry->body.zebra_message.source_as, asn_len);
649  read_asn(s, &entry->body.zebra_message.destination_as, asn_len);
650  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.zebra_message.interface_index);
651  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.zebra_message.address_family);
652 
653  entry->body.zebra_message.opt_len = 0;
654  entry->body.zebra_message.opt_data = NULL;
655  entry->body.zebra_message.notify_len = 0;
656  entry->body.zebra_message.notify_data = NULL;
657 
658  switch(entry->body.zebra_message.address_family) {
659  case AFI_IP:
660  entry->body.zebra_message.source_ip.v4_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
661  entry->body.zebra_message.destination_ip.v4_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
662  mstream_get (s, marker, 16);
663  break;
664  case AFI_IP6:
665  mstream_get(s,&entry->body.zebra_message.source_ip.v6_addr.s6_addr, 16);
666  mstream_get(s,&entry->body.zebra_message.destination_ip.v6_addr.s6_addr, 16);
667  mstream_get (s, marker, 16);
668  break;
669  case 0xFFFF:
670  /* Zebra doesn't dump ifindex or src/dest IPs in OPEN
671  * messages. Work around it. */
672  if (entry->body.zebra_message.interface_index == 0xFFFF) {
673  memset(marker, 0xFF, 4);
674  mstream_get (s, marker + 4, 12);
675  entry->body.zebra_message.interface_index = 0;
676  entry->body.zebra_message.address_family = AFI_IP;
677  entry->body.zebra_message.source_ip.v4_addr.s_addr = 0;
678  entry->body.zebra_message.destination_ip.v4_addr.s_addr = 0;
679  break;
680  }
681  /* Note fall through! If we don't recognize this type of data corruption, we say
682  * the address family is unsupported (since FFFF is not a valid address family) */
683  default:
684  /* unsupported address family */
685  bgpdump_warn("process_zebra_bgp_message: unsupported AFI %d",
686  entry->body.zebra_message.address_family);
687  return 0;
688  }
689 
690  if(memcmp(marker, "\377\377\377\377\377\377\377\377\377\377\377\377\377\377\377\377", 16) != 0) {
691  /* bad marker... ignore packet */
692  bgpdump_warn(
693  "bgp_message: bad marker: %02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x.%02x",
694  marker[0],marker[1],marker[2],marker[3],marker[4],marker[5],marker[6],marker[7],
695  marker[8],marker[9],marker[10],marker[11],marker[12],marker[13],marker[14],marker[15]);
696  return 0;
697  }
698 
699  mstream_getw(s,&entry->body.zebra_message.size);
700 
701  int expected = entry->body.zebra_message.size - sizeof(marker) - sizeof(u_int16_t);
702 
703  mstream_t copy = mstream_copy(s, expected);
704 
705  entry->body.zebra_message.cut_bytes = expected - mstream_can_read(&copy);
706 
707  switch(mstream_getc (&copy, &entry->body.zebra_message.type)) {
708  case BGP_MSG_OPEN:
709  return process_zebra_bgp_message_open(&copy, entry, asn_len);
710  case BGP_MSG_UPDATE:
711  return process_zebra_bgp_message_update(&copy, entry, asn_len);
712  case BGP_MSG_NOTIFY:
713  return process_zebra_bgp_message_notify(&copy, entry);
714  case BGP_MSG_KEEPALIVE:
715  /* Nothing to do */
716  return 1;
717  case BGP_MSG_ROUTE_REFRESH_01:
718  /* Not implemented yet */
719  bgpdump_warn("bgp_message: MSG_ROUTE_REFRESH_01 not implemented yet");
720  return 0;
721  case BGP_MSG_ROUTE_REFRESH:
722  /* Not implemented yet */
723  bgpdump_warn("bgp_message: MSG_ROUTE_REFRESH not implemented yet");
724  return 0;
725  default:
726  bgpdump_warn("bgp_message: unknown BGP message type %d",
727  entry->body.zebra_message.type);
728  return 0;
729  }
730 }
731 
732 int process_zebra_bgp_message_notify(struct mstream *s, BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry) {
733  mstream_getc(s, &entry->body.zebra_message.error_code);
734  mstream_getc(s, &entry->body.zebra_message.sub_error_code);
735  entry->body.zebra_message.notify_len = entry->body.zebra_message.size - 21;
736 
737  if(entry->body.zebra_message.notify_len > 0) {
738  entry->body.zebra_message.notify_data = malloc(entry->body.zebra_message.notify_len);
739  mstream_get(s, entry->body.zebra_message.notify_data, entry->body.zebra_message.notify_len);
740  }
741 
742  return 1;
743 }
744 
745 int process_zebra_bgp_message_open(struct mstream *s, BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry, u_int8_t asn_len) {
746  mstream_getc(s, &entry->body.zebra_message.version);
747  read_asn(s, &entry->body.zebra_message.my_as, asn_len);
748  mstream_getw(s, &entry->body.zebra_message.hold_time);
749  entry->body.zebra_message.bgp_id = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
750  mstream_getc(s, &entry->body.zebra_message.opt_len);
751 
752  if(entry->body.zebra_message.opt_len) {
753  entry->body.zebra_message.opt_data = malloc(entry->body.zebra_message.opt_len);
754  mstream_get(s, entry->body.zebra_message.opt_data, entry->body.zebra_message.opt_len);
755  }
756 
757  return 1;
758 }
759 
760 int process_zebra_bgp_message_update(struct mstream *s, BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry, u_int8_t asn_len) {
761  entry->body.zebra_message.incomplete.orig_len = 0;
762 
763  mstream_t withdraw_stream = mstream_copy(s, mstream_getw(s, NULL));
764  entry->body.zebra_message.withdraw_count = read_prefix_list(&withdraw_stream, AFI_IP,
765  entry->body.zebra_message.withdraw,
766  &entry->body.zebra_message.incomplete);
767 
768  entry->attr = process_attributes(s, asn_len, &entry->body.zebra_message.incomplete);
769 
770  entry->body.zebra_message.announce_count = read_prefix_list(s, AFI_IP,
771  entry->body.zebra_message.announce,
772  &entry->body.zebra_message.incomplete);
773 
774  return 1;
775 }
776 
777 int process_zebra_bgp_entry(struct mstream *s, BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry) {
778  bgpdump_warn("process_zebra_bgp_entry: record type not implemented yet");
779  return 0;
780 }
781 
782 int process_zebra_bgp_snapshot(struct mstream *s, BGPDUMP_ENTRY *entry) {
783  bgpdump_warn("process_zebra_bgp_snapshot: record type not implemented yet");
784  return 0;
785 }
786 
787 static attributes_t *attr_init(struct mstream *s, int len) {
788 
789  attributes_t *attr = malloc(sizeof(struct attr));
790 
791  attr->data=malloc(len);
792  memcpy(attr->data, &s->start[s->position], len);
793 
794  attr->len = len;
795  attr->flag = 0;
796  attr->origin = -1;
797  attr->nexthop.s_addr = INADDR_NONE;
798  attr->med = -1;
799  attr->local_pref = -1;
800  attr->aggregator_as = -1;
801  attr->aggregator_addr.s_addr = INADDR_NONE;
802  attr->weight = -1;
803 
804  attr->originator_id.s_addr = -1;
805  attr->cluster = NULL;
806 
807  attr->aspath = NULL;
808  attr->community = NULL;
809  attr->transit = NULL;
810  attr->mp_info = calloc(1, sizeof(struct mp_info));;
811 
812  attr->unknown_num = 0;
813  attr->unknown = NULL;
814 
815  attr->new_aspath = NULL;
816  attr->old_aspath = NULL;
817  attr->new_aggregator_as = -1;
818  attr->new_aggregator_addr.s_addr = INADDR_NONE;
819 
820  return attr;
821 }
822 
823 static void process_unknown_attr(struct mstream *s, attributes_t *attr, int flag, int type, int len) {
824  /* Unknown attribute. Save as is */
825  attr->unknown_num++;
826  attr->unknown = realloc(attr->unknown, attr->unknown_num * sizeof(struct unknown_attr));
827 
828  /* Pointer to the unknown attribute we want to fill in */
829  struct unknown_attr unknown = {
830  .flag = flag,
831  .type = type,
832  .len = len,
833  .raw = malloc(len)
834  };
835 
836  attr->unknown[attr->unknown_num - 1] = unknown;
837 
838  mstream_get(s, unknown.raw, len);
839 }
840 
841 static void process_one_attr(struct mstream *outer_stream, attributes_t *attr, u_int8_t asn_len, struct zebra_incomplete *incomplete) {
842  int flag = mstream_getc(outer_stream, NULL);
843  int type = mstream_getc(outer_stream, NULL);
844  int len;
845 
846  if(flag & BGP_ATTR_FLAG_EXTLEN)
847  len = mstream_getw(outer_stream,NULL);
848  else
849  len = mstream_getc(outer_stream,NULL);
850 
851  //info("flag:%-2i type:%-2i length:%i", flag, type, len);
852 
853  mstream_t ms = mstream_copy(outer_stream, len), *s = &ms;
854  if(mstream_can_read(s) != len) {
855  bgpdump_warn("ERROR attribute is truncated: expected=%u remaining=%u\n", len, mstream_can_read(s));
856  return;
857  }
858 
859  /* Take note of all attributes, including unknown ones */
860  if(type <= sizeof(attr->flag) * 8)
861  attr->flag |= ATTR_FLAG_BIT(type);
862 
863  switch(type) {
864  case BGP_ATTR_MP_REACH_NLRI:
865  process_mp_announce(s, attr->mp_info, incomplete);
866  break;
867  case BGP_ATTR_MP_UNREACH_NLRI:
868  process_mp_withdraw(s, attr->mp_info, incomplete);
869  break;
870  case BGP_ATTR_ORIGIN:
871  assert(attr->origin == -1);
872  attr->origin = mstream_getc(s, NULL);
873  break;
874  case BGP_ATTR_AS_PATH:
875  assert(! attr->aspath);
876  attr->aspath = create_aspath(len, asn_len);
877  mstream_get(s, attr->aspath->data, len);
878  /*process_attr_aspath_string(attr->aspath);*/
879  break;
880  case BGP_ATTR_NEXT_HOP:
881  assert(INADDR_NONE == attr->nexthop.s_addr);
882  attr->nexthop = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
883  break;
884  case BGP_ATTR_MULTI_EXIT_DISC:
885  assert(-1 == attr->med);
886  mstream_getl(s,&attr->med);
887  break;
888  case BGP_ATTR_LOCAL_PREF:
889  assert(-1 == attr->local_pref);
890  mstream_getl(s,&attr->local_pref);
891  break;
892  case BGP_ATTR_ATOMIC_AGGREGATE:
893  break;
894  case BGP_ATTR_AGGREGATOR:
895  // wrong aggregator as was checked here
896  assert(-1 == attr->aggregator_as);
897  read_asn(s, &attr->aggregator_as, asn_len);
898  attr->aggregator_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
899  break;
900  case BGP_ATTR_COMMUNITIES:
901  assert(! attr->community);
902  attr->community = malloc(sizeof(struct community));
903  attr->community->size = len / 4;
904  attr->community->val = malloc(len);
905  mstream_get(s,attr->community->val,len);
906  attr->community->str = NULL;
907  process_attr_community_string(attr->community);
908  break;
909  case BGP_ATTR_NEW_AS_PATH:
910  assert(! attr->new_aspath);
911  attr->new_aspath = create_aspath(len, ASN32_LEN);
912  mstream_get(s,attr->new_aspath->data, len);
913  /*process_attr_aspath_string(attr->new_aspath);*/
914  /* AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE and AS_CONFED_SET segments invalid in NEW_AS_PATH */
915  check_new_aspath(attr->new_aspath);
916  break;
917  case BGP_ATTR_NEW_AGGREGATOR:
918  assert(-1 == attr->new_aggregator_as);
919  read_asn(s, &attr->new_aggregator_as, ASN32_LEN);
920  attr->new_aggregator_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
921  break;
922  case BGP_ATTR_ORIGINATOR_ID:
923  assert(INADDR_NONE == attr->originator_id.s_addr);
924  attr->originator_id = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
925  break;
926  case BGP_ATTR_CLUSTER_LIST:
927  assert(! attr->cluster);
928  attr->cluster = malloc(sizeof(struct cluster_list));
929  attr->cluster->length = len/4;
930  attr->cluster->list = malloc((attr->cluster->length) * sizeof(struct in_addr));
931 
932  int i; // cluster index
933  for (i = 0; i < attr->cluster->length; i++)
934  attr->cluster->list[i] = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
935  break;
936  default:
937  process_unknown_attr(s, attr, flag, type, len);
938  }
939 }
940 
941 attributes_t *process_attributes(struct mstream *s, u_int8_t asn_len, struct zebra_incomplete *incomplete) {
942  int total = mstream_getw(s, NULL);
943 
944  attributes_t *attr = attr_init(s, total);
945  mstream_t copy = mstream_copy(s, total);
946 
947  if(mstream_can_read(&copy) != total)
948  bgpdump_warn("entry is truncated: expected=%u remaining=%u", total, mstream_can_read(&copy));
949 
950  while(mstream_can_read(&copy))
951  process_one_attr(&copy, attr, asn_len, incomplete);
952 
953  // Once all attributes have been read, take care of ASN32 transition
954  process_asn32_trans(attr, asn_len);
955 
956  return attr;
957 }
958 
959 struct aspath *create_aspath(u_int16_t len, u_int8_t asn_len) {
960  struct aspath *aspath = malloc(sizeof(struct aspath));
961  if(aspath) {
962  aspath->asn_len = asn_len;
963  aspath->length = len;
964  aspath->count = 0;
965  aspath->str = NULL;
966  if(len > 0)
967  aspath->data = malloc(len);
968  else
969  aspath->data = NULL;
970  }
971  return aspath;
972 }
973 
974 void aspath_error(struct aspath *as) {
975  as->count = 0;
976 
977  if(as->str) {
978  free(as->str);
979  as->str = NULL;
980  }
981 
982  as->str = malloc(strlen(ASPATH_STR_ERROR) + 1);
983  strcpy(as->str, ASPATH_STR_ERROR);
984 }
985 
986 /* AK adds buildstring flag as this func is used by bgpdump just to get the
987  number of hops (as->count) */
988 void process_attr_aspath_string(struct aspath *as, int buildstring) {
989 
990  const int MAX_ASPATH_LEN = 8000;
991 
992  if (buildstring) {
993  /* We could probably just skip processing, but lets play it safe --AK */
994  if (as->str != NULL) {
995  free(as->str);
996  as->str = NULL;
997  }
998  as->str = malloc(MAX_ASPATH_LEN);
999  }
1000 
1001  as->count = 0;
1002 
1003  /* Set default values */
1004  int space = 0;
1005  u_char type = AS_SEQUENCE;
1006  int pos = 0;
1007 
1008  /* Set initial pointer. */
1009  caddr_t pnt = as->data;
1010  caddr_t end = pnt + as->length;
1011  struct assegment *segment = NULL;
1012 
1013  u_int16_t tmp16;
1014  u_int32_t tmp32;
1015 
1016  int i;
1017  while (pnt < end) {
1018 
1019  /* For fetch value. */
1020  segment = (struct assegment *) pnt;
1021 
1022 
1023  /* Check AS type validity. */
1024  if ((segment->type != AS_SET) &&
1025  (segment->type != AS_SEQUENCE) &&
1026  (segment->type != AS_CONFED_SET) &&
1027  (segment->type != AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE))
1028  {
1029  aspath_error(as);
1030  return;
1031  }
1032 
1033  /* Check AS length. */
1034  if ((pnt + (segment->length * as->asn_len) + AS_HEADER_SIZE) > end)
1035  {
1036  aspath_error(as);
1037  return;
1038  }
1039 
1040  if (buildstring) {
1041  /* If segment type is changed, print previous type's end
1042  character. */
1043  if (type != AS_SEQUENCE)
1044  as->str[pos++] = aspath_delimiter_char (type, AS_SEG_END);
1045 
1046  if (space)
1047  as->str[pos++] = ' ';
1048 
1049  if (segment->type != AS_SEQUENCE)
1050  as->str[pos++] = aspath_delimiter_char (segment->type, AS_SEG_START);
1051 
1052  space = 0;
1053  }
1054 
1055  /* Increment as->count - NOT ignoring CONFED_SETS/SEQUENCES any more.
1056  I doubt anybody was relying on this behaviour anyway. */
1057  switch(segment->type) {
1058  case AS_SEQUENCE:
1059  case AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE:
1060  as->count += segment->length;
1061  break;
1062  case AS_SET:
1063  case AS_CONFED_SET:
1064  as->count += 1;
1065  break;
1066  }
1067 
1068  if (buildstring) {
1069  for (i = 0; i < segment->length; i++)
1070  {
1071  as_t asn;
1072 
1073  if (space)
1074  {
1075  if (segment->type == AS_SET
1076  || segment->type == AS_CONFED_SET)
1077  as->str[pos++] = ',';
1078  else
1079  as->str[pos++] = ' ';
1080  }
1081  else
1082  space = 1;
1083 
1084  int asn_pos = i * as->asn_len;
1085  switch(as->asn_len) {
1086  case ASN16_LEN:
1087  memcpy(&tmp16, segment->data+asn_pos, sizeof(u_int16_t));
1088  asn = ntohs (tmp16);
1089  break;
1090  case ASN32_LEN:
1091  memcpy(&tmp32, segment->data+asn_pos, sizeof(u_int32_t));
1092  asn = ntohl (tmp32);
1093  break;
1094  default:
1095  assert("invalid asn_len" && false);
1096  return;
1097  }
1098 
1099  pos += bgpdump_int2str(asn, as->str + pos);
1100  if(pos > MAX_ASPATH_LEN - 100) {
1101  strcpy(as->str + pos, "...");
1102  return;
1103  };
1104  }
1105  }
1106 
1107  type = segment->type;
1108  pnt += (segment->length * as->asn_len) + AS_HEADER_SIZE;
1109  }
1110 
1111  if (buildstring) {
1112  if (segment && segment->type != AS_SEQUENCE)
1113  as->str[pos++] = aspath_delimiter_char (segment->type, AS_SEG_END);
1114 
1115  as->str[pos] = '\0';
1116  }
1117 }
1118 
1119 char aspath_delimiter_char (u_char type, u_char which) {
1120  int i;
1121  struct
1122  {
1123  int type;
1124  char start;
1125  char end;
1126  } aspath_delim_char [] =
1127  {
1128  { AS_SET, '{', '}' },
1129  { AS_SEQUENCE, ' ', ' ' },
1130  { AS_CONFED_SET, '[', ']' },
1131  { AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE, '(', ')' },
1132  { 0, '\0', '\0' }
1133  };
1134 
1135  for (i = 0; aspath_delim_char[i].type != 0; i++)
1136  {
1137  if (aspath_delim_char[i].type == type)
1138  {
1139  if (which == AS_SEG_START)
1140  return aspath_delim_char[i].start;
1141  else if (which == AS_SEG_END)
1142  return aspath_delim_char[i].end;
1143  }
1144  }
1145  return ' ';
1146 }
1147 
1148 
1149 void process_attr_community_string(struct community *com) {
1150  if(com == NULL) {
1151  return;
1152  }
1153 
1154  char buf[BUFSIZ];
1155  int i;
1156  u_int32_t comval;
1157  u_int16_t as;
1158  u_int16_t val;
1159 
1160  memset (buf, 0, BUFSIZ);
1161 
1162  for (i = 0; i < com->size; i++)
1163  {
1164  memcpy (&comval, com_nthval (com, i), sizeof (u_int32_t));
1165  comval = ntohl (comval);
1166  switch (comval)
1167  {
1168  case COMMUNITY_NO_EXPORT:
1169  strlcat (buf, " no-export", BUFSIZ);
1170  break;
1171  case COMMUNITY_NO_ADVERTISE:
1172  strlcat (buf, " no-advertise", BUFSIZ);
1173  break;
1174  case COMMUNITY_LOCAL_AS:
1175  strlcat (buf, " local-AS", BUFSIZ);
1176  break;
1177  default:
1178  as = (comval >> 16) & 0xFFFF;
1179  val = comval & 0xFFFF;
1180  snprintf (buf + strlen (buf), BUFSIZ - strlen (buf),
1181  " %d:%d", as, val);
1182  break;
1183  }
1184  }
1185 
1186  com->str = malloc(strlen(buf)+1);
1187  strcpy(com->str, buf);
1188 }
1189 
1190 static struct mp_nlri *get_nexthop(struct mstream *s, u_int16_t afi) {
1191  struct mp_nlri *nlri = calloc(1, sizeof(struct mp_nlri));
1192 
1193  nlri->nexthop_len = mstream_getc(s, NULL);
1194 
1195  // sometimes nexthop_len is 0 - not sure what this means (see IS-626)
1196  // if(mp_nlri->nexthop_len == 0)
1197  // return len;
1198 
1199  if(afi == AFI_IP) {
1200  assert(nlri->nexthop_len == 4);
1201  nlri->nexthop.v4_addr = mstream_get_ipv4(s);
1202  return nlri;
1203  }
1204  assert(afi == AFI_IP6);
1205  mstream_get(s, &nlri->nexthop.v6_addr, 16);
1206  if(nlri->nexthop_len == 32) {
1207  /* Is there also a link-local address? */
1208  mstream_get(s, &nlri->nexthop_local.v6_addr.s6_addr, 16);
1209  } else if(nlri->nexthop_len != 16) {
1210  bgpdump_warn("process_mp_announce: unknown MP nexthop length %d", nlri->nexthop_len);
1211  }
1212  return nlri;
1213 }
1214 
1215 void process_mp_announce(struct mstream *s, struct mp_info *info, struct zebra_incomplete *incomplete) {
1216  u_int16_t afi;
1217  u_int8_t safi;
1218 
1219  // look for MRT abbreviated MP_NLRI packets
1220  if(s->start[s->position] != 0) {
1221  assert(info->announce[AFI_IP6][SAFI_UNICAST] == NULL);
1222  info->announce[AFI_IP6][SAFI_UNICAST] = get_nexthop(s, AFI_IP6);
1223  return;
1224  }
1225 
1226  mstream_getw(s, &afi);
1227  mstream_getc(s, &safi);
1228 
1229  if(afi > BGPDUMP_MAX_AFI || safi > BGPDUMP_MAX_SAFI) {
1230  bgpdump_warn("process_mp_announce: unknown protocol(AFI=%d, SAFI=%d)!", afi, safi);
1231  return;
1232  }
1233 
1234  if(info->announce[afi][safi] != NULL) {
1235  bgpdump_warn("process_mp_announce: two MP_NLRI for the same protocol(%d, %d)!", afi, safi);
1236  return;
1237  }
1238 
1239  info->announce[afi][safi] = get_nexthop(s, afi);
1240 
1241  // SNPA is defunct and num_snpa should always be 0
1242  u_int8_t num_snpa;
1243  if(mstream_getc(s, &num_snpa))
1244  bgpdump_warn("process_mp_announce: MP_NLRI contains SNPAs, skipping");
1245  for(; num_snpa > 0; --num_snpa) {
1246  mstream_get(s, NULL, mstream_getc(s, NULL));
1247  }
1248 
1249  info->announce[afi][safi]->prefix_count = read_prefix_list(s, afi, info->announce[afi][safi]->nlri, incomplete);
1250 }
1251 
1252 void process_mp_withdraw(struct mstream *s, struct mp_info *info, struct zebra_incomplete *incomplete) {
1253  u_int16_t afi;
1254  u_int8_t safi;
1255  struct mp_nlri *mp_nlri;
1256 
1257  mstream_getw(s, &afi);
1258  mstream_getc(s, &safi);
1259 
1260  /* Do we know about this address family? */
1261  if(afi > BGPDUMP_MAX_AFI || safi > BGPDUMP_MAX_SAFI) {
1262  bgpdump_warn("process_mp_withdraw: unknown AFI,SAFI %d,%d!", afi, safi);
1263  return;
1264  }
1265 
1266  /* If there are 2 NLRI's for the same protocol, fail but don't burn and die */
1267  if(info->withdraw[afi][safi] != NULL) {
1268  bgpdump_warn("process_mp_withdraw: update contains more than one MP_NLRI with AFI,SAFI %d,%d!", afi, safi);
1269  return;
1270  }
1271 
1272  /* Allocate structure */
1273  mp_nlri = malloc(sizeof(struct mp_nlri));
1274  memset(mp_nlri, 0, sizeof(struct mp_nlri));
1275  info->withdraw[afi][safi] = mp_nlri;
1276 
1277  mp_nlri->prefix_count = read_prefix_list(s, afi, mp_nlri->nlri, incomplete);
1278 }
1279 
1280 static int read_prefix_list(struct mstream *s, u_int16_t afi, struct prefix *prefixes, struct zebra_incomplete *incomplete) {
1281  int count = 0;
1282 
1283  while(mstream_can_read(s)) {
1284  u_int8_t p_len = mstream_getc(s,NULL); // length in bits
1285  u_int8_t p_bytes = (p_len + 7) / 8;
1286 
1287  /* Truncated prefix list? */
1288  if(mstream_can_read(s) < p_bytes) {
1289  if(! incomplete)
1290  break;
1291 
1292  /* Put prefix in incomplete structure */
1293  incomplete->afi = afi;
1294  incomplete->orig_len = p_len;
1295  incomplete->prefix = (struct prefix) {
1296  .len = mstream_can_read(s) * 8
1297  };
1298  mstream_get(s, &incomplete->prefix.address, p_bytes);
1299  break;
1300  }
1301 
1302  struct prefix *prefix = prefixes + count;
1303 
1304  if(count++ > MAX_PREFIXES)
1305  continue;
1306 
1307  *prefix = (struct prefix) { .len = p_len };
1308  mstream_get(s, &prefix->address, p_bytes);
1309  }
1310 
1311  if(count > MAX_PREFIXES) {
1312  bgpdump_err("too many prefixes (%i > %i)", count, MAX_PREFIXES);
1313  assert(0); // AK adds to force a fatal error
1314  return MAX_PREFIXES;
1315  }
1316 
1317  return count;
1318 }
1319 
1320 static as_t read_asn(struct mstream *s, as_t *asn, u_int8_t len) {
1321  u_int16_t asn16;
1322 
1323  assert(len == sizeof(u_int32_t) || len == sizeof(u_int16_t));
1324  switch(len) {
1325  case sizeof(u_int32_t):
1326  return mstream_getl(s, asn);
1327  case sizeof(u_int16_t):
1328  mstream_getw(s, &asn16);
1329  if(asn)
1330  *asn = asn16;
1331  return asn16;
1332  default:
1333  /* Not reached. Avoid compiler warning */
1334  return 0;
1335  }
1336 }
1337 
1338 int check_new_aspath(struct aspath *aspath) {
1339  struct assegment *segment;
1340  for(segment = (struct assegment *) aspath->data;
1341  segment < (struct assegment *) (aspath->data + aspath->length);
1342  segment = (struct assegment *) ((char *) segment + sizeof(*segment) + segment->length * ASN32_LEN)) {
1343  if(segment->type == AS_CONFED_SEQUENCE || segment->type == AS_CONFED_SET) {
1344  bgpdump_warn("check_new_aspath: invalid segment of type AS_CONFED_%s in NEW_AS_PATH",
1345  segment->type == AS_CONFED_SET ? "SET" : "SEQUENCE");
1346  return 0;
1347  }
1348  }
1349  return 1;
1350 }
1351 
1352 void process_asn32_trans(attributes_t *attr, u_int8_t asn_len) {
1353  if(asn_len == ASN32_LEN) {
1354  /* These attributes "SHOULD NOT" be used with ASN32. */
1355  if(attr->flag & ATTR_FLAG_BIT(BGP_ATTR_NEW_AS_PATH))
1356  bgpdump_warn("process_asn32_trans: ASN32 message contains NEW_AS_PATH attribute");
1357 
1358  if(attr->flag & ATTR_FLAG_BIT(BGP_ATTR_NEW_AGGREGATOR))
1359  bgpdump_warn("process_asn32_trans: ASN32 message contains NEW_AGGREGATOR attribute");
1360 
1361  /* Don't compute anything, just leave AS_PATH and AGGREGATOR as they are */
1362  return;
1363  }
1364 
1365  /* Process NEW_AGGREGATOR */
1366  if(attr->flag & ATTR_FLAG_BIT(BGP_ATTR_AGGREGATOR) &&
1367  attr->flag & ATTR_FLAG_BIT(BGP_ATTR_NEW_AGGREGATOR)) {
1368  /* Both AGGREGATOR and NEW_AGGREGATOR present, merge */
1369  if(attr->aggregator_as != AS_TRAN) {
1370  /* Don't do anything */
1371  return;
1372  } else {
1373  attr->old_aggregator_as = attr->aggregator_as;
1374  attr->old_aggregator_addr = attr->aggregator_addr;
1375  attr->aggregator_as = attr->new_aggregator_as;
1376  attr->aggregator_addr = attr->new_aggregator_addr;
1377  }
1378  }
1379 
1380  /* Process NEW_AS_PATH */
1381  if(! (attr->flag & ATTR_FLAG_BIT(BGP_ATTR_NEW_AS_PATH)))
1382  return;
1383 
1384  // AK HAX: This code requries the aspath->count field to be populated. This is
1385  // (unfortunately) computed by the process_attr_aspath_string function, so we
1386  // call it here.
1387  process_attr_aspath_string(attr->aspath, 0);
1388  process_attr_aspath_string(attr->new_aspath, 0);
1389 
1390  // attr->aspath may be NULL, at least in case of MP_UNREACH_NLRI
1391  if(attr->aspath == NULL) return;
1392  if(attr->aspath->count < attr->new_aspath->count) {
1393  return;
1394  }
1395 
1396  /* Merge paths */
1397  attr->old_aspath = attr->aspath;
1398  attr->aspath = asn32_merge_paths(attr->old_aspath, attr->new_aspath);
1399  //if(attr->aspath) {
1400  // process_attr_aspath_string(attr->aspath);
1401  //}
1402 }
1403 
1404 struct aspath *asn32_merge_paths(struct aspath *path, struct aspath *newpath) {
1405  struct aspath *mergedpath = create_aspath(0, ASN32_LEN);
1406  struct assegment *segment, *mergedsegment;
1407  int newlen;
1408 
1409  /* Keep copying segments from AS_PATH until our path is as long as AS_PATH - NEW_AS_PATH. */
1410  segment = (struct assegment *) (path->data);
1411  while(mergedpath->count < (path->count - newpath->count)) {
1412  /* Make room */
1413  newlen = mergedpath->length + sizeof(struct assegment) + segment->length * ASN32_LEN;
1414  mergedpath->data = realloc(mergedpath->data, newlen);
1415 
1416  /* Create a new AS-path segment */
1417  mergedsegment = (struct assegment *) (mergedpath->data + mergedpath->length);
1418 
1419  /* Copy segment over. AS_PATH contains 16-bit ASes, so expand */
1420  mergedsegment->type = segment->type;
1421  mergedsegment->length = segment->length;
1422  asn32_expand_16_to_32(mergedsegment->data, segment->data, segment->length);
1423 
1424  /* Update length */
1425  mergedpath->length = newlen;
1426  if(segment->type == AS_SET || segment->type == AS_CONFED_SET) {
1427  mergedpath->count += 1;
1428  } else {
1429  mergedpath->count += segment->length;
1430  /* Did we copy too many ASes over? */
1431  if(mergedpath->count > path->count - newpath->count) {
1432  mergedsegment->length -= mergedpath->count - (path->count - newpath->count);
1433  mergedpath->length -= (mergedpath->count - (path->count - newpath->count)) * ASN32_LEN;
1434  }
1435  }
1436  }
1437 
1438  /* Append NEW_AS_PATH to merged path */
1439  mergedpath->data = realloc(mergedpath->data, mergedpath->length + newpath->length);
1440  memcpy(mergedpath->data + mergedpath->length, newpath->data, newpath->length);
1441  mergedpath->length += newpath->length;
1442 
1443  return mergedpath;
1444 }
1445 
1446 void asn32_expand_16_to_32(char *dst, char *src, int len) {
1447  u_int32_t *dstarray = (u_int32_t *) dst;
1448  u_int16_t *srcarray = (u_int16_t *) src;
1449  int i;
1450 
1451  for(i = 0; i < len; i++) {
1452  dstarray[i] = htonl(ntohs(srcarray[i]));
1453  }
1454 }
1455

1457 size_t strlcat(char *dst, const char *src, size_t size) {
1458  if (strlen (dst) + strlen (src) >= size)
1459  return -1;
1460 
1461  strcat (dst, src);
1462 
1463  return (strlen(dst));
1464 }
